</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:12%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	loss on sale of the Lahnstein Mill includes a net curtailment gain related to the divesture of the pension plan of $15.8&nbsp;million, including a
	$5.5&nbsp;million write-off of deferred actuarial losses.
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During
	the first quarter of 2013, we received a refund of excess pension contributions from the terminated Terrace Bay pension plan. As a result, we
	recorded income before income taxes from discontinued operations of $4.2&nbsp;million and a related provision for income taxes of $1.6&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(3)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	November 2012, audits of the 2007 and 2008 tax years were finalized with a finding of no additional taxes due. As a result, we recognized a non-cash tax
	benefit of $4.5&nbsp;million related to the reversal of certain liabilities for uncertain income tax positions.
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(4)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	On
	October&nbsp;31, 2015, we sold the Lahnstein Mill. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014, 2013, 2012 and 2011, the results of operations
	and the loss on sale of the Lahnstein Mill are reported as discontinued operations in the Consolidated Statement of Operations Data.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(f)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	August 2015, we purchased all of the outstanding equity of FiberMark for approximately $118&nbsp;million. In July 2014, we purchased all of the
	outstanding equity of Crane for approximately $72&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(g)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	At
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, we adopted ASC Topic No.&nbsp;2015-03 and ASC Topic No.&nbsp;2015-17 and elected to apply the guidance retroactively to all
	periods presented. See Note&nbsp;2, "Summary of Significant Accounting Policies&nbsp;&#151; Recently Adopted Accounting Standards."
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	25
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227338Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DI15301_1_26">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227338Z10-K_HTM_BG15301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_FINANCIAL_DATA>
<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227338Z10-K_HTM_DI15301_ITEM_7__MANAGEMENT_S_DISCUSSIO__ITE03668">
</A>
<A NAME="A2227338Z10-K_HTM_TOC_DI15301_1">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Item&nbsp;7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	The following discussion and analysis presents the factors that had a material effect on our results of operations during the
	years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013. Also discussed is our financial position as of the end of those years. You should read this discussion in conjunction with our consolidated
	financial statements and the notes to those consolidated financial statements included elsewhere in this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K. This Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial
	Condition and Results of Operations contains forward-looking statements. See "Forward-Looking Statements" for a discussion of the uncertainties, risks and assumptions associated with these
	statements.
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Introduction
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	This Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition is intended to provide investors with an understanding of the historical performance
	of our business, its financial condition and its prospects. We will discuss and provide our analysis of the following:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Overview of Business;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Business Segments;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Results of Operations and Related Information;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Liquidity and Capital Resources;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Adoption of New Accounting Pronouncements; and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Critical Accounting Policies and Use of Estimates.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Overview of Business
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We are a leading producer of technical products and premium fine papers and packaging. We have two primary operations: our technical products
	business and our fine paper and packaging
	business (formerly known as the fine paper business). On January&nbsp;1, 2015, we changed the name of our fine paper business to fine paper and packaging. The name change better reflects the
	increasing importance, and plans for continued growth, of our premium packaging products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our
	mission is to create value by improving the image and performance of everything we touch. We expect to create value by growing in specialized niche markets that value performance or image and
	where we have competitive advantages. In managing our businesses, we believe that achieving and maintaining a leadership position in our markets, responding effectively to customer needs and
	competitive challenges, employing capital optimally, controlling costs and managing risks are important to long-term success. Changes in input costs and general economic conditions also impact our
	results. In this discussion and analysis, we will refer to these factors.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Competitive Environment
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Our past results have been and our
	future prospects will be significantly affected by the competitive environment in which we operate. In most of our markets, our businesses compete directly with well-known competitors, some of which
	are larger and more diversified. While our businesses are oriented to premium performance and quality they may also face competitive pressures from lower value products.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Economic Conditions and Input Costs
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;The markets for all of
	our products are affected to a significant degree by economic conditions, including rapid changes in input costs, particularly for pulp, latex and natural gas that may not be recovered immediately
	through pricing or other actions. Our results are also affected by fluctuations in exchange rates, particularly for the Euro.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	26
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=28,EFW="2227338",CP="NEENAH PAPER INC",DN="1",CHK=207622,FOLIO='26',FILE='DISK127:[15ZCW1.15ZCW15301]DI15301A.;18',USER='CHE106319',CD='23-FEB-2016;22:03' -->
<A NAME="A2227338Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DI15301_1_27">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227338Z10-K_HTM_BG15301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Business Segments
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	On July&nbsp;1, 2015, we reorganized our internal management structure and, accordingly, addressed our segment reporting structure. As a result of
	this reorganization, the Other operating segment (composed of the non-premium Index, Tag and Vellum Bristol product lines acquired as part of the purchase of the Wausau brands) was combined with the
	Fine Paper and Packaging operating segment to reflect the manner in which this business is managed. Segment information for prior periods has been restated to conform to the current period
	presentation. In addition, as part of the FiberMark Acquisition, we acquired certain product lines composed of papers sold to converters for end uses such as covering materials for datebooks, diaries,
	yearbooks and traditional photo albums. Due to the dissimilar nature of these products, management decided that they would not be managed as part of either the existing Fine Paper and Packaging or
	Technical Products businesses.
	As a result, effective August&nbsp;1, 2015, these product lines represent an operating segment which does not meet the quantitative threshold for a reportable segment and are accordingly reported as
	an Other operating segment. Our reportable operating segments now consist of Technical Products, Fine Paper and Packaging and Other.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our
	technical products business is a leading international producer of transportation, water and other filter media and durable, saturated and coated substrates for a variety of end markets. We focus
	on categories where we believe we are, or can be, a market leader, which include, among others, the transportation, water and other filtration media, specialty tape, abrasive, label and other
	technical products markets. Our technical products manufacturing facilities are located near Munich, Germany, in Bolton, England, in Munising, Michigan and Pittsfield, Massachusetts. In addition,
	certain products manufactured in shared facilities acquired in the FiberMark Acquisition support our technical products business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	believe our fine paper and packaging business is the leading supplier of premium printing and other high end specialty papers in North America. Our products include some of the most recognized and
	preferred papers in North America, where we enjoy leading market positions in many of our product categories. We sell our products primarily to authorized paper distributors, as well as through
	converters, major national retailers and specialty businesses. Our fine paper and packaging manufacturing facilities are located in Appleton, Neenah and Whiting, Wisconsin and Canton, Ohio. In
	addition, certain products manufactured in shared facilities acquired in the FiberMark Acquisition support our fine paper and packaging business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	other segment includes certain product lines composed of papers sold to converters for end uses such as covering materials for datebooks, diaries, yearbooks and traditional photo albums.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Results of Operations and Related Information
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In this section, we discuss and analyze our net sales, income before interest and income taxes (which we refer to as "operating income" in this
	Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations) and other information relevant to an understanding of our results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Executive Summary
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	On August&nbsp;1, 2015, we purchased all of the outstanding equity of FiberMark from American Securities for a purchase price of approximately
	$118&nbsp;million. The purchase price was financed through $80&nbsp;million of cash on hand and the balance from available borrowing capacity on our Global Revolving Credit Facilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	On
	October&nbsp;31, 2015 we sold our Lahnstein Mill to the Kajo Neukirchen Group for net cash proceeds of approximately $5.4&nbsp;million. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, discontinued
	operations reported on the consolidated statements of operations reflect the results of operations and the loss on sale of the Lahnstein Mill. The consolidated statements of operations for years ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013 have been restated to report results of the Lahnstein Mill as discontinued operations. The results of the Lahnstein Mill were previously reported in the Technical
	Products segment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, consolidated net sales increased $48.0&nbsp;million from the prior year period to $887.7&nbsp;million as organic technical products volume growth,
	incremental sales from the FiberMark Acquisition and higher average selling prices were partially offset by unfavorable currency exchange effects. Excluding currency exchange effects and incremental
	sales from FiberMark, consolidated sales increased $28.4&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	27
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=29,EFW="2227338",CP="NEENAH PAPER INC",DN="1",CHK=346085,FOLIO='27',FILE='DISK127:[15ZCW1.15ZCW15301]DI15301A.;18',USER='CHE106319',CD='23-FEB-2016;22:03' -->
<A NAME="A2227338Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DI15301_1_28">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227338Z10-K_HTM_BG15301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Consolidated
	operating income of $101.4&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 increased $14.8&nbsp;million from the prior year. The favorable comparison to the prior year was
	primarily due to lower manufacturing input costs, higher net price for both businesses and organic technical products volume growth. These favorable variances were partially offset by higher
	manufacturing costs, increased selling, general and administrative costs ("SG&amp;A"), including amounts related to FiberMark; lower fine paper and packaging volume and unfavorable currency effects.
	Excluding results of the FiberMark Acquisition, currency effects and aggregate charges of $6.4&nbsp;million in 2015 for integration and restructuring costs and aggregate charges of
	$6.0&nbsp;million in 2014 for integration and restructuring costs, costs related to the early extinguishment of debt and a pension plan settlement charge, operating income for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 increased $16.3&nbsp;million from the prior year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Cash
	provided by operating activities of $111.2&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was $16.7&nbsp;million favorable to cash provided by operating activities of
	$94.5&nbsp;million in the prior year primarily due to higher operating earnings and lower post-retirement benefit plan contributions.
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>
	&#8203;
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;FONT-SIZE:1.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>

	&#8203;
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<FONT>

</DIV>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Consolidated
	net sales for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 were $48.0&nbsp;million (6%) higher than the prior year due to organic technical products volume growth, incremental sales from the
	FiberMark Acquisition and higher average selling prices, partially offset by unfavorable currency exchange effects. Excluding incremental FiberMark sales and currency exchange effects, consolidated
	net sales increased $28.4&nbsp;million from the prior year.
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Net sales in our technical products business increased $25.6&nbsp;million (6%) from the prior year as organic volume growth,
	incremental sales from the FiberMark Acquisition and higher selling prices were only partially offset by unfavorable currency exchange effects. Unfavorable currency exchange effects resulted from the
	Euro weakening by approximately 16&nbsp;percent relative to the U.S. dollar in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the prior year. Excluding currency exchange effects and
	incremental FiberMark sales, technical product sales increased $40.7&nbsp;million (10%) and volumes increased approximately 11% from the prior year period due to growth in shipments of filtration
	and specialty performance products and incremental sales from the technical materials business acquired in July 2014.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Net sales in our fine paper and packaging business increased $6.6&nbsp;million (2%) from the prior year due to higher average net
	prices and incremental FiberMark sales. Excluding acquired revenues, fine paper and packaging sales decreased $12.3&nbsp;million (3%) as higher average net price was more than offset by a four
	percent decrease in sales volumes. Sales volumes were unfavorable to the prior year as increases in premium packaging and retail products were more than offset by lower sales of other grades;
	including lower margin special make business. Average net price improved from the prior year due to a two percent increase in average selling prices and a more favorable product mix.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	28
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Consolidated
	net sales for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 were $58.0&nbsp;million (7%) higher than the prior year due to incremental technical products volume related to the acquired
	technical materials business, increased volume for both businesses and higher average selling prices.
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Net sales in our technical products business increased $50.3&nbsp;million (14%) due to increased volume and higher average selling
	prices. Excluding incremental sales from the acquisition, technical product sales increased $26.2&nbsp;million (7%) due to a seven percent increase in shipments as volume increased for all product
	categories led by backings, transportation filtration and specialty products. Average selling prices increased approximately 1.5&nbsp;percent from the prior year due to a more favorable product mix
	and higher selling prices.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Net sales in our fine paper and packaging business increased $7.7&nbsp;million (2%) from the prior year due to higher average net
	prices and increased volume. Average net price improved from the prior year due to a more favorable product mix and a one percent increase in average selling prices. Sales volumes increased
	approximately one percent from the prior year period primarily due to growth in shipments of core premium products, luxury packaging and labels, and incremental sales of approximately
	$1.5&nbsp;million in the first quarter of 2014 from the acquisition of the Southworth brands (acquired on January&nbsp;31, 2013).
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_17"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>

	Analysis of Operating Income&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Years Ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014
	and 2013
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>

	is intended to provide a perspective of trends in our historical results:

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-LEFT:10PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Net sales
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;

<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	accordance with generally accepted accounting principles in the United States ("GAAP"), consolidated operating income includes the pre-tax effects of unusual items. We believe that by adjusting
	reported operating income to exclude the effects of these items, the resulting adjusted operating income is on a basis that reflects the results of our ongoing operations. We believe that providing
	adjusted operating results will help investors gain an additional perspective of underlying business trends and results. Adjusted operating income is not a recognized term under GAAP and should not be
	considered in isolation or as a substitute for operating income derived in accordance with GAAP. Other companies may use different methodologies for calculating their non-GAAP financial measures and,
	accordingly, our non-GAAP financial measures may not be comparable to their measures.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_19"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(a)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Includes
	price changes, net of changes in product mix.
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(b)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Includes
	price changes for raw materials and energy.
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(c)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, Technical Products results include $1.4&nbsp;million of acquisition integration costs related to the
	FiberMark Acquisition and $0.4&nbsp;million of restructuring costs. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, Technical Products results include $1.0&nbsp;million of acquisition integration
	costs related to the acquired technical materials business and $0.6&nbsp;million of restructuring costs.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	30
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=32,EFW="2227338",CP="NEENAH PAPER INC",DN="1",CHK=294903,FOLIO='30',FILE='DISK127:[15ZCW1.15ZCW15301]DK15301A.;20',USER='CHE106319',CD='23-FEB-2016;22:03' -->
<A NAME="A2227338Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DK15301_1_31">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227338Z10-K_HTM_BG15301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(d)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, Fine Paper and Packaging results include $1.5&nbsp;million of acquisition integration costs related to the
	FiberMark Acquisition
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(e)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, results for the Other segment include $2.4&nbsp;million of acquisition integration costs related to the
	FiberMark Acquisition.
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(f)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, unallocated corporate costs include $0.8&nbsp;million of restructuring costs. For the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014 unallocated corporate costs include a pension plan settlement charge of $3.5&nbsp;million, $0.2&nbsp;million of costs related to the amendment and restatement of our bank
	credit agreement and $0.7&nbsp;million of restructuring costs.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Consolidated
	operating income of $101.4&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 increased $14.8 million (17%) from the prior year. The favorable comparison was primarily due to
	lower manufacturing input costs, higher net price for the fine paper and packaging business, and organic technical products volume growth; partially offset by higher manufacturing costs, increased
	SG&amp;A, including amounts acquired as part of the
	FiberMark Acquisition; lower fine paper and packaging volume and unfavorable currency effects. Excluding results of the FiberMark Acquisition, currency effects and aggregate charges of
	$6.5&nbsp;million in 2015 for integration and restructuring costs and aggregate charges of $6.0&nbsp;million in 2014 for integration and restructuring costs, costs related to the early
	extinguishment of debt and a pension plan settlement charge, operating income for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 increased $18.8&nbsp;million (20%) from the prior year.
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Operating income for our technical products business increased $8.1&nbsp;million (18%) from the prior year primarily due to lower
	manufacturing input costs, organic volume growth and higher selling prices. These favorable variances were partially offset by unfavorable currency exchange effects and higher manufacturing costs.
	Results for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 include $1.8&nbsp;million and $1.6&nbsp;million for integration/restructuring costs, respectively. Excluding incremental volume from
	the FiberMark Acquisition, unfavorable currency exchange effects and acquisition integration/restructuring costs, operating income for the technical products business increased $11.2&nbsp;million
	(24%).
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Operating income for our fine paper and packaging business increased $6.5&nbsp;million (11%) from the prior year period primarily
	due to lower manufacturing input costs principally as a result of lower natural gas prices and higher net price. Extreme winter weather conditions during the first quarter of 2014 resulted in a
	temporary increase in natural gas prices. These favorable variances were partially offset by lower shipment volume and higher manufacturing costs. Results for the ended December&nbsp;31, 2015
	include $1.5&nbsp;million for acquisition related integration costs. Excluding incremental volume from the FiberMark Acquisition and acquisition integration costs, operating income for the fine
	paper and packaging business increased $8.8&nbsp;million (14%).
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Unallocated corporate costs for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 were $18.0&nbsp;million, or $2.2&nbsp;million favorable to
	the prior year. Excluding charges of $0.8&nbsp;million in 2015 for restructuring costs and aggregate charges of $4.4&nbsp;million in 2014 for a pension plan settlement charge, restructuring costs
	and costs related to the early extinguishment of debt, unallocated corporate expenses were $1.4&nbsp;million unfavorable to the prior year primarily due to increased employee compensation costs.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Year 2014 versus 2013
</I>
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>
</TD>

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(a)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Includes
	price changes, net of changes in product mix.
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(b)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Includes
	price changes for raw materials and energy.
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(c)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, Technical Products results include $1.0&nbsp;million of integration costs related to the acquired technical
	materials business and $0.4&nbsp;million of restructuring costs.
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(d)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, Fine Paper and Packaging results include $0.4&nbsp;million of integration costs related to the Southworth
	acquisition.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	31
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=33,EFW="2227338",CP="NEENAH PAPER INC",DN="1",CHK=942850,FOLIO='31',FILE='DISK127:[15ZCW1.15ZCW15301]DK15301A.;20',USER='CHE106319',CD='23-FEB-2016;22:03' -->
<A NAME="A2227338Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DK15301_1_32">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227338Z10-K_HTM_BG15301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(e)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 unallocated corporate costs include a pension plan settlement charge of $3.5&nbsp;million, $0.2&nbsp;million
	of costs related to the amendment and restatement of our bank credit agreement and $0.7&nbsp;million of restructuring costs. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 unallocated corporate costs
	include $0.5&nbsp;million of costs related to the early redemption of 2014 Senior Notes and a $0.2&nbsp;million pension plan settlement charge.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Consolidated
	operating income of $86.6&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 increased $4.0&nbsp;million from the prior year. Excluding aggregate charges of $6.0&nbsp;million
	in 2014 for integration and restructuring costs, costs related to the early extinguishment of debt and a pension plan settlement charge and aggregate charges of $1.1&nbsp;million in 2013 for
	acquisition-related integration costs, costs related to the early extinguishment of debt and a pension plan settlement charge, operating income for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 increased
	$8.9&nbsp;million from the prior year. The improvement in operating income was primarily due to higher net price for both businesses and incremental technical products volume, including volume
	related to the acquired technical materials business, partially offset by higher manufacturing input costs in our fine paper and packaging business.
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Operating income for our technical products business increased $8.6&nbsp;million (23%) from the prior year. The improvement in
	operating income was primarily due to a more favorable product mix, growth in shipments for all product categories and incremental volume related to the acquired technical materials business. The more
	favorable product mix was primarily due to growth in higher value filtration and specialty shipments. In 2014, other manufacturing costs increased versus the prior year due to additional costs related
	to annual maintenance downs at our German facilities, including an extended down at our filtration plant to increase the capabilities and capacity of one of the machines. Results for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014 include $1.6&nbsp;million for integration/restructuring costs.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Operating income for our fine paper and packaging business decreased $0.2&nbsp;million from the prior year as higher average net
	selling prices, manufacturing operating efficiencies and increased shipment volume were more than offset by $7.0&nbsp;million in higher manufacturing input costs, including more than
	$3.0&nbsp;million for natural gas in the first quarter of 2014. Results for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 include $0.4&nbsp;million for acquisition related integration costs.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Unallocated corporate costs for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 were $20.0&nbsp;million, or $4.4&nbsp;million unfavorable
	to the prior year. Excluding aggregate charges of $4.4&nbsp;million in 2014 for a pension plan settlement charge, restructuring costs and costs related to the early extinguishment of debt and
	aggregate charges of $0.7&nbsp;million in 2013 for costs related to the early extinguishment of debt and a pension plan settlement charge, unallocated corporate expenses were $0.7&nbsp;million
	unfavorable to the prior year.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Additional Statement of Operations Commentary:
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	SG&amp;A expense of $86.5&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was $8.5&nbsp;million higher than the prior year
	due to incremental selling and administrative costs related to the FiberMark Acquisition. SG&amp;A expense as a percentage of net sales for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, was approximately
	9.8&nbsp;percent and was 0.5&nbsp;percentage points higher than the prior year as the increase in net sales in the current year was more than offset by higher SG&amp;A expenses.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	SG&amp;A
	expense of $78.0&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 was $3.3&nbsp;million higher than the prior year primarily due to incremental selling and administrative costs
	related to the acquired technical materials business and increased employee compensation costs. SG&amp;A expense as a percentage of net sales for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, was approximately
	9.3&nbsp;percent and was 0.3&nbsp;percentage points lower than the prior year as the increase in net sales in the current year more than offset higher SG&amp;A expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, we incurred $11.7&nbsp;million, $11.4&nbsp;million and
	$11.2&nbsp;million of interest expense, respectively. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, the increase in interest expense from the prior year was primarily due to incremental Revolver
	borrowings under our bank loan agreement to finance the FiberMark Acquisition.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	32
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227338Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DM15301_1_33">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_STABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227338Z10-K_HTM_BG15301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In general, our effective tax rate differs from the U.S. statutory tax rate of 35&nbsp;percent primarily due to the benefits of our
	corporate tax structure, the benefit of R&amp;D Credits and the proportion of pre-tax income in jurisdictions with marginal tax rates that differ from the U.S. statutory tax rate. For the years ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, our effective income tax rate related to continuing operations was 33&nbsp;percent and 10&nbsp;percent, respectively. The increase in our effective tax rate for
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 from the prior year was primarily due to the recognition of greater amounts of R&amp;D Credits in 2014. Excluding the benefit of R&amp;D Credits related to prior year
	activities, our effective income tax rate for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 would be approximately 33&nbsp;percent. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, our effective income tax
	rate related to continuing operations was approximately 32&nbsp;percent. For a reconciliation of effective tax rate to the U.S. federal statutory tax rate, see Note&nbsp;5 of Notes to Consolidated
	Financial Statements, "Income Taxes."
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Operating Cash Flow Commentary
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Cash provided by operating activities of $111.2&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was $16.7&nbsp;million
	favorable to cash provided by operating activities of $94.5&nbsp;million in the prior year. The favorable comparison was primarily due to a $16.1&nbsp;million increase in operating income and
	lower contributions and benefit payments for post-retirement benefit obligations. These favorable variances were partially offset by a decrease of $9.0&nbsp;million in our investment in working
	capital in the prior year compared to a decrease of $1.8&nbsp;million in our investment in working capital for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Cash provided by operating activities of $94.5&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 was $11.0&nbsp;million
	favorable to cash provided by operating activities of $83.5&nbsp;million in the prior year. The favorable comparison was primarily due to higher operating income and a $9.0&nbsp;million decrease
	in our investment in working capital for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to an increase in our investment in working capital of $6.6&nbsp;million in the prior year. These favorable
	variances were partially offset by increased contributions and benefit payments for post-retirement benefit obligations.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Investing Commentary:
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, cash used by investing activities was $160.1&nbsp;million and
	$104.9&nbsp;million, respectively. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, cash used by investing activities includes $118.2&nbsp;million for the FiberMark Acquisition. For the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014, cash used by investing activities includes $72.4&nbsp;million for the purchase of the Crane Technical Materials business and $2.9&nbsp;million for the acquisition of a
	non-controlling equity investment in a joint venture in India. Cash used by investing activities for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 includes a payment of $5.2&nbsp;million to acquire the
	Southworth brands.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	33
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=35,EFW="2227338",CP="NEENAH PAPER INC",DN="1",CHK=714878,FOLIO='33',FILE='DISK127:[15ZCW1.15ZCW15301]DM15301A.;22',USER='CHE108063',CD='24-FEB-2016;19:34' -->
<A NAME="A2227338Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DM15301_1_34">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227338Z10-K_HTM_BG15301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Capital expenditures for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 were $48.1&nbsp;million compared to spending of
	$27.9&nbsp;million in the prior year. In general, we expect aggregate annual capital expenditures of approximately 3 to 5&nbsp;percent of net sales. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015,
	annual capital expenditures were at the higher end of that range due to incremental investment in filtration assets in the U.S. We expect capital spending in 2016 to continue at the higher end of this
	range. We believe that the level of our capital spending can be more than adequately funded from cash provided from operating activities and allows us to maintain the efficiency and cost effectiveness
	of our assets and also invest in expanded manufacturing capabilities to successfully pursue strategic initiatives and deliver attractive returns.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, we received net cash proceeds of $5.4&nbsp;million from the sale of the Lahnstein Mill.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013, cash used by investing activities was $104.9&nbsp;million and
	$33.3&nbsp;million, respectively. Cash used by investing activities for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 includes $72.4&nbsp;million for the purchase of the Crane Technical Materials
	business and $2.9&nbsp;million for the acquisition of a non-controlling equity investment in a joint venture in India. Cash used by investing activities for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013
	includes a payment of $5.2&nbsp;million to acquire the Southworth brands.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Capital expenditures for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 were $27.9&nbsp;million compared to spending of
	$28.7&nbsp;million in the prior year.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Financing Commentary:
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our liquidity requirements are provided by cash generated from operations and short and long-term borrowings.
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, cash used by financing activities was $18.8&nbsp;million compared to cash provided by
	financing activities of $10.2&nbsp;million for the prior year. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, cash provided by financing activities was $10.2&nbsp;million compared to cash provided
	by financing activities of $15.0&nbsp;million for the prior year. Cash flows from financing activities for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, included proceeds of $175&nbsp;million from the
	issuance of the 2021 Senior Notes and outflows of $90&nbsp;million for the early redemption of the 2014 Senior Notes.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Secured Bank Credit Facility
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In December 2014, we entered into the Third Amended Credit Agreement. The Third Amended Credit Agreement, among other things: (1)&nbsp;increased
	the maximum principal amount of our existing credit facility for the U.S. Revolving Credit Facility to $125&nbsp;million; (2)&nbsp;established the German Revolving Credit Facility in the maximum
	principal amount of $75&nbsp;million; (3)&nbsp;caused Neenah and the other domestic borrowers to guarantee, among other things, the obligations arising under the German Revolving Credit Facility;
	(4)&nbsp;provides for the Global Revolving Credit Facilities to mature on December&nbsp;18, 2019; and (5)&nbsp;provides for an accordion feature permitting one or more increases in the Global
	Revolving Credit Facilities in an aggregate principal amount not exceeding $50&nbsp;million, such that the aggregate commitments under the Global Revolving Credit Facilities do not exceed
	$250&nbsp;million. In addition, domestic borrowers may request letters of credit under the U.S. Revolving Credit Facility in an aggregate face amount not to exceed $20&nbsp;million outstanding at
	any time,
	and German borrowers may request letters of credit under the German Revolving Credit Facility in an aggregate face amount not to exceed $2&nbsp;million outstanding at any time. See Note&nbsp;6 of
	Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements, "Debt."
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Unsecured Senior Notes
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In May 2013, we issued $175&nbsp;million of 2021 Senior Notes. Proceeds from this offering were used to retire the remaining principal amount of
	2014 Senior Notes, to repay approximately $56&nbsp;million in outstanding revolver borrowings under our bank credit agreement and for general corporate purposes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	May 2013, we completed an early redemption of $20&nbsp;million of our 2014 Senior Notes. The 2014 Senior Notes were redeemed at par value plus accrued but unpaid interest. The early redemption
	was financed with revolver borrowings under our bank credit agreement and resulted in a pre-tax loss of $0.1&nbsp;million due to the write-off of related unamortized debt issuance costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	34
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=36,EFW="2227338",CP="NEENAH PAPER INC",DN="1",CHK=637648,FOLIO='34',FILE='DISK127:[15ZCW1.15ZCW15301]DM15301A.;22',USER='CHE108063',CD='24-FEB-2016;19:34' -->
<A NAME="A2227338Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DM15301_1_35">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227338Z10-K_HTM_BG15301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	June 2013, we used a portion of the proceeds from the issuance of the 2021 Senior Notes to retire the remaining $70&nbsp;million in outstanding 2014 Senior Notes. The 2014 Senior Notes were
	redeemed at par value plus accrued but unpaid interest. The retirement of the 2014 Senior Notes resulted in a pre-tax loss of $0.3&nbsp;million due to the write-off of related unamortized debt
	issuance costs. As of December&nbsp;31, 2014 there were no 2014 Senior Notes outstanding. See Note&nbsp;6 of Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements, "Debt."
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Other Debt
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In June 2014, we repaid the remaining &euro;3.7&nbsp;million ($5.2&nbsp;million) in outstanding project financing borrowings under the
	German Loan Agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	January 2013, Neenah Germany entered into the Second German Loan Agreement to finance the construction of a melt blown machine. The agreement provides for &euro;9.0&nbsp;million of
	construction financing which is secured by the melt blown machine. The loan matures in September 2022 and principal is repaid in equal quarterly installments beginning in December 2014. At
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, &euro;7.6&nbsp;million ($8.3&nbsp;million, based on exchange rates at December&nbsp;31, 2015) was outstanding under the Second German Loan Agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Availability under our revolving credit facility varies over time depending on the value of our inventory, receivables and various
	capital assets. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had $51.1&nbsp;million outstanding under our Revolver and $122.9&nbsp;million of available credit (based on exchanges rates at
	December&nbsp;31, 2015). During the fourth quarter, the proceeds from Revolver borrowings in Germany were used to fund the repatriation of cash to the U.S.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We have required debt payments through December&nbsp;31, 2016 of $1.2&nbsp;million on the Second German Loan Agreement.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, cash and cash equivalents decreased $68.4&nbsp;million to $4.2&nbsp;million at
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 from $72.6&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2014. Total debt (including the reclassification of deferred financing costs) increased $1.2&nbsp;million to
	$229.4&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2015 from $228.2&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2014. Net debt (total debt minus cash and cash equivalents) increased by $69.6&nbsp;million
	primarily due to the FiberMark Acquisition for $118.2&nbsp;million partially offset by cash flow from operations.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, our cash balance consists of $1.1&nbsp;million in the U.S. and $3.1&nbsp;million held at entities
	outside of the U.S. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, there were no restrictions regarding the repatriation of our non-U.S. cash and, we believe, the repatriation of these cash balances to the U.S.
	would not materially increase our income tax provision.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Transactions with shareholders
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, we paid cash dividends of $1.20 per common share or $20.3&nbsp;million and
	$1.02 per common share or $17.1&nbsp;million, respectively.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	November 2015, our Board of Directors approved a ten percent increase in the annual dividend rate on our common stock to $1.32 per share. The dividend is scheduled to be paid in four equal
	quarterly installments
	beginning in March 2016. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, under the most restrictive terms of our debt agreements, our ability to pay cash dividends on our common stock is limited to a total of
	$25&nbsp;million in a 12-month period. However, we can pay dividends in excess of such limitation by utilizing "restricted payment baskets" as defined in the indenture for the 2021 Senior Notes and
	the Third Amended Credit Agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In May 2015, our Board of Directors authorized the 2015 Stock Purchase Plan. The 2015 Stock Purchase Plan allows us to repurchase up
	to $25&nbsp;million of our outstanding Common Stock through May 2016. Purchases under the 2015 Stock Purchase Plan will be made from time to time in the open market or in privately negotiated
	transactions in accordance with the requirements of applicable law. The timing and amount of any purchases will depend on share price, market conditions and other factors. The 2015 Stock Purchase Plan
	does not require us to purchase any specific number of shares and may be suspended or discontinued at any time. The 2015 Stock Purchase Plan replaced the 2014 Stock Purchase Plan that expired in May
	2015. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, we acquired approximately 42,100 shares of Common Stock at a cost of $2.4&nbsp;million and 60,900 shares of Common Stock at a cost of
	$3.5&nbsp;million pursuant to the 2015 Stock Purchase Plan and the 2014 Stock Purchase Plan, respectively.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	35
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<A NAME="A2227338Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DM15301_1_36">

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227338Z10-K_HTM_BG15301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For
	the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, we acquired approximately 40,000 and 56,000 of Common Stock, respectively, at a cost of $2.5&nbsp;million and $3.4&nbsp;million,
	respectively, for shares surrendered by employees to pay taxes due on vested restricted stock awards and stock appreciation rights exercised. In addition, we received $1.2&nbsp;million and
	$3.6&nbsp;million in proceeds from the exercise of employee stock options for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014,
	we recognized excess tax benefits of $2.6&nbsp;million and $5.6&nbsp;million, respectively, related to the vesting or exercise of stock-based awards.
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Other Items:
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In 2015, all remaining U.S. federal NOLs have been utilized and we made approximately $10.6&nbsp;million in U.S. federal income tax
	payments. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had $78.1&nbsp;million of state NOLs. Our state NOLs may be used to offset approximately $2.5&nbsp;million in state income taxes. If not used,
	substantially all of the state NOLs will expire in various amounts between 2016 and 2035. In addition, we had $30.2&nbsp;million of U.S. federal and state R&amp;D Credits which, if not used, will expire
	between 2027 and 2035 for the U.S. federal R&amp;D Credits and between 2017 and 2030 for the state R&amp;D Credits. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we recorded a valuation allowance of $2.9&nbsp;million
	against a portion of the R&amp;D Credits.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Management
	believes that our ability to generate cash from operations and our borrowing capacity are adequate to fund working capital, capital spending and other cash needs for the next
	12&nbsp;months. Our ability to generate adequate cash from operations beyond 2015 will depend on, among other things, our ability to successfully implement our business strategies, control costs in
	line with market conditions and manage the impact of changes in input prices and currencies. We can give no assurance we will be able to successfully implement these items.
</FONT>
</P>

<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(a)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Interest
	payments on long-term debt includes interest on variable rate debt at December&nbsp;31, 2015 weighted average interest rates.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(b)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	open purchase orders displayed in the table represent amounts we anticipate will become payable within the next 12&nbsp;months for goods and services
	that we have negotiated for delivery.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(c)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	above table includes future payments that we will make for postretirement benefits other than pensions. Those amounts are estimated using actuarial
	assumptions, including expected future service, to project the future obligations.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(d)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	minimum purchase commitments in 2016 are primarily for coal contracts. Although we are primarily liable for payments on the above operating leases and
	minimum purchase commitments, based on historic operating performance and forecasted future cash flows, we believe our exposure to losses, if any, under these arrangements is not material.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>

<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->

</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

	See Note&nbsp;2, "Summary of Significant Accounting Policies&nbsp;&#151; Recently Adopted Accounting Standards" for a description of
	accounting standards adopted in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>

</FONT>

<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=38,EFW="2227338",CP="NEENAH PAPER INC",DN="1",CHK=682609,FOLIO='36',FILE='DISK127:[15ZCW1.15ZCW15301]DM15301A.;22',USER='CHE108063',CD='24-FEB-2016;19:34' -->
<A NAME="A2227338Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DM15301_1_37">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227338Z10-K_HTM_BG15301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Critical Accounting Policies and Use of Estimates
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The preparation of financial statements in conformity with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles ("GAAP") in the United States requires estimates
	and assumptions that affect the reported amounts and related disclosures of assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and net sales and expenses during the reporting period.
	Actual results could differ from these estimates, and changes in these estimates are recorded when known. The critical accounting policies used in the preparation of the consolidated financial
	statements are those that are important both to the presentation of financial condition and results of operations and require significant judgments with regard to estimates used. These critical
	judgments relate to the reported amounts of assets and liabilities, disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities, and the reported amounts of expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	following summary provides further information about the critical accounting policies and should be read in conjunction with the notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements. We believe that the
	consistent application of our policies provides readers of our financial statements with useful and reliable information about our operating results and financial condition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	have discussed the application of these critical accounting policies with our Board of Directors and Audit Committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Inventories
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We value U.S. inventories at the lower of cost, using the Last-In, First-Out ("LIFO") method, or market. German inventories are valued at the lower
	of cost, using a weighted-average cost method, or market. The First-In, First-Out value of U.S. inventories valued on the LIFO method was $118.2&nbsp;million and $95.7&nbsp;million at
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively and exceeded such LIFO value by $10.0&nbsp;million and $14.0&nbsp;million, respectively. Cost includes labor, materials and production overhead.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Income Taxes
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we have recorded aggregate deferred income tax assets of $20.0&nbsp;million related to temporary differences, net
	operating losses and research and development and other tax credits. As of December&nbsp;31, 2014, our aggregate deferred income tax assets were $45.7&nbsp;million. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015,
	we recorded a valuation allowance of $2.9&nbsp;million against a portion of our R&amp;D Credits. No valuation allowance was provided at December&nbsp;31, 2014. In determining the need for a valuation
	allowance, we consider many factors, including specific taxing jurisdictions, sources of taxable income, income tax strategies and forecasted earnings for the entities in each jurisdiction. A
	valuation allowance would be recognized if, based on the weight of available evidence, we conclude that it is more likely than not that some portion or all of the deferred income tax assets will not
	be realized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, our liability for uncertain income taxes positions was $12.8&nbsp;million and $7.0&nbsp;million, respectively. In evaluating and estimating tax positions
	and tax benefits, we consider many factors which may result in periodic adjustments and which may not accurately anticipate actual outcomes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Pension and Other Postretirement Benefits
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Pension Plans
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Except
	as described below for FiberMark, substantially all active employees of our U.S. operations participate in defined benefit pension plans and/or defined contribution
	retirement plans. Neenah Germany has defined benefit plans designed to provide a monthly pension upon retirement for substantially all its employees in Germany. In addition, we maintain a supplemental
	retirement contribution plan (the "SERP") which is a non-qualified defined benefit plan. We provide benefits under the SERP to the extent necessary to fulfill the intent of our defined benefit
	retirement plans without regard to the limitations set by the Internal Revenue Code on qualified defined benefit plans.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	FiberMark
	has a qualified defined benefit plan covering certain U.S. employees. During 2009, FiberMark fully froze this plan so that additional benefits cannot be earned as a result of additional
	years of service or increases in annual earnings. Plan assets are principally invested in equity, government and corporate debt securities and fixed income mutual funds. FiberMark has a defined
	benefit plan covering all United Kingdom "U.K." employees, which is designed to provide a monthly pension upon retirement. This plan was fully frozen during 2011 and plan assets are primarily invested
	in equity mutual funds.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	37
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=39,EFW="2227338",CP="NEENAH PAPER INC",DN="1",CHK=859949,FOLIO='37',FILE='DISK127:[15ZCW1.15ZCW15301]DM15301A.;22',USER='CHE108063',CD='24-FEB-2016;19:34' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227338Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DO15301_1_38">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_STABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227338Z10-K_HTM_BG15301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our funding policy for qualified defined benefit plans is to contribute assets to fully fund the accumulated benefit obligation, as required by the Pension Protection Act of
	2006. Subject to regulatory and tax deductibility limits, any funding shortfall is to be eliminated over a reasonable number of years. Nonqualified plans providing pension benefits in excess of
	limitations imposed by the taxing authorities are not funded. There is no legal or governmental obligation to fund Neenah Germany's benefit plans and as such the plans are currently unfunded.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Consolidated
	pension expense related to continuing operations for defined benefit pension plans was $6.5&nbsp;million, $10.8&nbsp;million and $6.9&nbsp;million for the years ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively. The weighted-average expected long-term rate of return on pension fund assets used to calculate pension expense was 6.50&nbsp;percent,
	6.50&nbsp;percent and 7.00&nbsp;percent for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively. The expected long-term rate of return on pension fund assets held by our pension
	trusts was determined based on several factors, including input from pension investment consultants and projected long-term returns of broad equity and bond indices. We also considered the plans'
	historical 10-year and 15-year compounded annual returns. We anticipate that, on average, actively managed U.S. pension plan assets will generate annual long-term rates of return of at least
	6.50&nbsp;percent. Our expected long-term rate of return on the assets in the plans is based on an asset allocation assumption of about 35&nbsp;percent with equity managers, with expected
	long-term rates of return of approximately 8 to 10&nbsp;percent, and 65&nbsp;percent with fixed income managers, with an expected long-term rate of return of approximately 4 to 6&nbsp;percent.
	The actual asset allocation is regularly reviewed and periodically rebalanced
	to the targeted allocation when considered appropriate. We evaluate our investment strategy and long-term rate of return on pension asset assumptions at least annually.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Pension
	expense is estimated based on the fair value of assets rather than a market-related value that averages gains and losses over a period of years. Investment gains or losses represent the
	difference between the expected return calculated using the fair value of the assets and the actual return based on the fair value of assets. The variance between the actual and the expected gains and
	losses on pension assets is recognized in pension expense more rapidly than it would be if a market-related value for plan assets was used. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, our pension plans had
	cumulative unrecognized investment losses and other actuarial losses of $84.1&nbsp;million. These unrecognized net losses may increase our future pension expense if not offset by (i)&nbsp;actual
	investment returns that exceed the assumed investment returns, (ii)&nbsp;other factors, including reduced pension liabilities arising from higher discount rates used to calculate our pension
	obligations or (iii)&nbsp;other actuarial gains, including whether such accumulated actuarial losses at each measurement date exceed the "corridor" determined under ASC Topic 715.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	discount (or settlement) rate that is utilized for determining the present value of future pension obligations in the U.S. is generally based on the yield for a theoretical basket of AA-rated
	corporate bonds currently available in the market place, whose duration matches the timing of expected pension benefit payments. The discount (or settlement) rate that is utilized for determining the
	present value of future pension obligations in Germany is generally based on the IBOXX index of AA-rated corporate bonds adjusted to match the timing of expected pension benefit payments. The weighted
	average discount rate utilized to determine the present value of future pension obligations at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 was 4.54&nbsp;percent and 3.91&nbsp;percent, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our
	consolidated pension expense in 2015 is based on the expected weighted-average long-term rate of return on assets and the weighted-average discount rate described above and various other
	assumptions. Pension expense beyond 2015 will depend on future investment performance, our contributions to the pension trusts, changes in discount rates and various other factors related to the
	covered employees in the plans.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	fair value of the assets in our defined benefit plans at December&nbsp;31, 2015 of approximately $308&nbsp;million increased approximately $20&nbsp;million from the fair value of about
	$288&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2014, as assets acquired in the FiberMark Acquisition and employer contributions exceeded investment losses and benefit payments. At December&nbsp;31,
	2015, the projected benefit obligations of our defined benefit plans exceeded the fair value of plan assets by approximately $52&nbsp;million which was approximately $10&nbsp;million larger than
	the $42&nbsp;million deficit at December&nbsp;31, 2014. The accumulated benefit obligation exceeded the fair value of plan assets by $40.6&nbsp;million and $25.4&nbsp;million at
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. Contributions to pension trusts for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 were $1.0&nbsp;million compared with $24.5&nbsp;million for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. In addition, we made direct benefit payments for unfunded qualified and supplemental retirement benefits of $1.8&nbsp;million and $1.6&nbsp;million for the years
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	38
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
